OOC: Sunhawk's entire life is driven by 2 things:

1. A deep respect for his military superiors.

2. A deep hate for Predicons (which is ironic after
fighting against the "Neo-Maximals in the War of
Agendas I made up read his bio to find out about it).

--- Jonathan <jhogan@...> wrote:
> OOC:
> 
> You didn't give her chance as you recall Sunhawk was
> rather busy attempting
> to slag her on sight...
> 
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Kyle Stewart" <dewboy30816@...>
> To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
> Sent: Saturday, April 06, 2002 3:10 PM
> Subject: Re: Questions and Answers
> 
> 
> > OOC: From her bio I'm guessing Nightshade is lying
> > through her teeth.  If not I didn't catch the
> white
> > flag situation.
> >
> > BIC:  Mustex looked in anger as his superior
> called
> > the Predicon a "guest".  He fastened Drillbit down
> to
> > be revived by the medic.
> >
> > --- Jonathan <jhogan@...> wrote:
> > > {Talos}
> > >
> > >     Talos arrived in the CR chamber room and
> looked
> > > over the monitor
> > > applying to their recent guest. Examining it
> slowly
> > > his optics widened as
> > > the system specks were rather...unique...for a
> > > predicon. Shifting and moving
> > > from behind the console the bot moved to the CR
> > > chamber and pushed the
> > > release switch.
> > >
> > >     As the chamber door slid upwards he noted
> the
> > > predicon was both awake
> > > and waiting, he had expected some resistance but
> > > then again considering her
> > > configuration it wasn't a big surprise. "My name
> is
> > > Talos and you are now a
> > > guest of the Maximals."
> > >
> > >     Nightshade looked at Talos and shrugged,
> moving
> > > out of the chamber
> > > looking up at him, "Nightshade, you really
> should do
> > > something about that
> > > bird bot of yours. Even we know what white flag
> > > conditions mean."
> > >
> > >     Talos tilted his head, Sunhawk hadn't
> mentioned
> > > that his prisoner had
> > > been taken while under truce conditions. Sighing
> he
> > > shrugged, "It changes
> > > very little I assume you were looking for
> something
> > > and I want to know
> > > what." He said gruffly indicating the fem bot
> should
> > > walk before him from
> > > the room.
> > >
> > >     Walking out Nightshade wasn't suprised to
> hear
> > > the soft click of a
> > > readied weapon behind her. "I came seeking the
> > > maximal leader of this troop,
> > > I have business to discuss with him or her. Mind
> > > escorting me to your leader
> > > rather than the brig?"
> > >
> > >     Talos chuckled the nozzle of the pistol
> prodding
> > > her back, "Well state
> > > your business, you've met him."
> > >
> > >     Nightshade turned looking at Talos
> skepticly,
> > > "How do I know you're
> > > telling the truth, the current example of
> maximals
> > > in this troop have been
> > > less than honorable..." Her voice dropped low
> her
> > > tone almost insulting.
> > > "Besides what I need to discuss has to be done
> away
> > > from prying optics and
> > > sensors. Know a place?"
> > >
> > >     Talos nodded grimly indicating the direction
> > > towards the bridges ready
> > > room, an office of sorts for commanders of a
> ship.
> > > Putting away the pistol
> > > both Talos and Nightshade moved to the room.
> > >
> > >
